intro: Osmitopsis pinnatifida subsp. pinnatifida, commonly known as the slender leaf osmitopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, often displaying shades of yellow or white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
